title: Preferred tool for digital art work
content:
**I’m afraid I’ll get chronic pain in my arm if I don’t change from working with a mouse soon. Intense – and monotonous – typographic design work _&c_ tend to really be a killer. I do switch from right to left from time to time if i’m not too stressed, but I’d like to make a leap from mouse to some kind of stylus tablet.**

What is your experience and recommendations?

Yours

ƒ

author: fredo

comments.content: I love my mouse... it’s not necessarily about a mouse per se but a holistic combo of what sort of mouse it is, how you use it, click speeds, movement speeds across the screen, how high you are relative to your desk, how straight/bent your arm is, how far you are form your screen etc. I’m left-handed but still use right handed button settings - works for me. Sorry, not very helpful.

First off you may have a serious medical condition that may need to be checked by physician- Carpal Tunnel Syndrome, Tendonitis, or something worse.

I would suggest to relax your grip on what ever tool you are using- mouse or otherwise. Soft click as opposed to hard ones. Make hard fists every so often. Wiggle your fingers and take stretch breaks too.

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Repetitive\_strain\_injury](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615181214/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Repetitive_strain_injury "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Repetitive\_strain\_injury")

Also you may consider consulting with an expert in office ergonomics... its a tax write off for sure and these people can help you situate your office in way that will be more productive and healthy for you..

I live with chronic pain too ( not from computers ) so I can relate to how you feel. I hope you find a way to ease your symptoms.

Mikey

**Our office masseuse will be here this friday, she knows a lot about ergonomics. Last time she recommended me some kind of wacom tablet, but for the specifics I rely on You. I don’t want to get Tendonitis!**

ƒ

I have a little optical track ball. I’ve been on the ball for a very long time and find it better all around. I do use the software to tune it, so slight motions are slowed down even more and quick motions cover lots of area.
